“His passion is winning and making everyone aware that winning is the only option here. Now let’s all be united until the very end of the season and do this together. Thank you for your support.”

#MerciArsène https://t.co/2kp18R2BqW

“There’s now an emphasis on us doing it for him too. We want to send him off as he deserves: with a cup. It’s our duty to give him that farewell. He’s a legend here and will always be remembered as one.”

#MerciArsène https://t.co/xjZKfN7Xvp

“He gave us the opportunity to explore ourselves to be successful. The memories of winning titles with him and bringing joy to so many people will stay with me forever.” 

#MerciArsène https://t.co/tflvFd6g0o

“He made me aware that there’s room for trust and honesty, to care about people. There have been a lot of highs and lows but how he went through tough times has taught me a lot about his character, about how to trust people to be successful.”

#MerciArsène https://t.co/37ebi7dMl1

“One thing which has impressed me most is his calmness when there’s a storm of pressure. The trust for his team and individuals is so massive. In sport, people change a lot when things go wrong but him trusting people to learn from those mistakes is huge.”

#MerciArsène https://t.co/ffVhEnSvCs

“I remember the first time we spoke was over the phone and he spoke in German, which impressed me. Right from the first conversation, I was ready to fight for him and the club. I was so glad, so satisfied in that moment.”

#MerciArsène https://t.co/6XoW0qeME3

“He’s trusted me so much throughout my career, in bringing me here, giving me the opportunity to play and making me captain even when I was injured. He also gave me a future role here at the club.” 

#MerciArsène https://t.co/epfGOtPjm7

“We were only informed on Friday about the manager’s decision to step down at the end of the season, so it’s still quite emotional. He’s been so supportive to me and one major reason why I’m here is because of him.”

#MerciArsène https://t.co/APewy1RXeu
